tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: I visited Doctor 12 years back with my pregnancy issues now bless with 2 boys. (10&6) till date I am continuing with her and she become my family Doctor.  I have refered many of friends and relatives  who too are very happy and satisfied with her.  I would say she the same when I met her  first time very passionate, friendly,has lot patience to answer our quries.I understand sometimes the waiting time is more but we should understand that Doctors have emergencies in between. When doctors have so much patience why don't we. Worth waiting :-)
reply_text:
Thanks 😊
 Very nice to know that you understand our difficulties also.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: I was suffering from pelvic organ prolapse for the past one year.in Jan 2021 I saw an ad.in news paper about the hospital and dr.srikala prasad.she is a very unique personality to put in short.expertise combined with friendly  attitude to patients which cannot go to together generally .I was very very comfortable with her treatment.very pleasing.petiently heard our problems.within 2 days after surgery I was discharged.now it is 10 days since the surgery I am feeling very comfortable.I wish God should shower her with good health and long life to serve people.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
Her welcome smile is the best thing that has ever happened to the profession. The warmth that this Doctor provides her patients would no doubt endear her to them for lifetime. She patiently evaluates the patients and lends a willing ear to repeated queries too.

Her support staff should ensure that no disrepute is brought to this mild mannered *** ************* doctor. by issue of tokens to patients who come without appointments and also allowing people holding appointment confirmation SMS on their mobiles to meet the Doctor at the appointed time or shortly thereafter. No one would mind 
the waiting time to meet this Doctor. However the support staff should be sensitised to inform the order in which patients can meet the Doctor.

People waiting made a hue and cry on this account during my last visit and the ever sensitive Doctor came out and reassured the patients that she would do her best to treat the patients adding that she treats patients even beyond midnight!

Kudos Doctor. Great work. We pray for your well being.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
We Know Dr.Sri Kala Prasad for the past 15 Years. She was the Dr for My Mrs.Saira Banu  2nd Baby delivery. She was waited for the delivery from 11 PM to up to 2 AM. I received my daughter Raasheeda with my Mrs.good and healthy condition. 

Dr is friendly and respect our feelings

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: Visited the doctor on June 8th but unfortunately had a  not so good experience of my life.  Because I have never seen a doctor who is so unprofessional with in 2 min in to my appointment she received a call which she continued  for at least 10 then the call got disconnected so my mother request her to attend us first as we have baby at home but with out even listening she stated talking in phone again and left the room. So myself and my mom left the clinic disappointed and in distress . I wish to convey to her **** * **** ****** ****** never allow her patient to wait.
reply_text:
Thanks for your feedback.
But I wish to say that you came after your appointment time was over  having made me waste my time sitting idle giving reasons like traffic jam .
I had finished my committed appointment time.
 But still I didn't want to send you back. Listened to your issues and explained that medically it's not ideal to do the way you wanted. It's not ideal to go against good medical good guide lines even though patients desire that.
I did explain to you nearly three times.
I was receiving a very important call for which I had been waiting for hours and days and as the clarity of the phone call was bad,I had to go out to answer .
  I wish to remind you that you didn't even wait to see me and came after my scheduled appointment was over and I had to leave.
Please let me know if doctors don't have any right to their time and be  bound 24/7 only for attending patients.  Remember you came after your appointment time.
I have spent my time and expertise in explaining to you regarding your health, but still you opted to leave and this is done without taking any fees from you.
Still ....I continue to take care of the health needs of our patients because of the real passion I have for this profession.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
We want to thank the Doctor for her amazing treatment and kindness towards each and every patients she treated.  She was so friendly. She explained us clearly and detailed every time we met her. 
She introduced her network doctors to support us in all the possible ways and helped us a lot. 

Now my Mother-in-law feeling much better all because of the Doctor's magic. 

Thanks a ton and wish you all the very best for your future endeavors.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: I have met srikala mam for my maternity by the suggestion from my husband. She is very friendly and I got PIH in my 8th month. She always take my calls whenever I needed and always response to my messages. She delivered a healthy boy baby and all thanks to you mam.

review:
My mother is over 80 and we were very concerned about her undergoing any surgery for that matter. We looked around for a uro-gynaeocologist and Dr Srikala Prasad was highly recommended by friends. 
We are very happy since my mother is under her care. As a surgeon she is one among the best. She is very direct and approachable. She has a very busy schedule but takes time to attend to questions. She builds confidence and is very humane. 
I would highly recommend her to others for related consultation and surgeries.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
PRACTO CHK PREVAILING FEES, THEN PUBLISH IN PORTAL. YOU STATED 550, BUT, DUE TO CORONA, DR CHGD RS.800. 

What do you think can be improved?*
Explanation of the health issue
Treatment satisfaction
Value for money
ALL ABV 3 REQUIRES IMPROVEMENT.
reply_text:
Thanks for your having taken time to give feedback.
The fees written in the portal is rs. 800.
You can check.
After wearing the PPE and the tight mask we are just able to breathe.
We are hypoxic ourselves.
I have  noted the patient's
 problem, examined the patient, suggested treatment and answered all your questions. I have not left any question unanswered.
I take your advice and stop coming for consultation till we are able to examine patients without ourselves feeling lack of oxygen.
I thank you from the bottom of my heart for making me understand the real situation.
God bless you.🙏🙏🙏🙏🙏🙏🙏🙏

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,
review: Doctor was very friendly with the patient and took care and advised the patient that she would do the needful and not to worry about the treatment.

tags: Doctor friendliness,
review: We were made to wait for more than an hour. The appointment was at 6pm.  We met the doctor at 7:15pm. In spite of an appointment, we were put in queue with everyone else. Very bad experience.
reply_text:
Thanks for having taken time for giving me the feedback.
I'm sorry that your appointment was delayed.
I wish to tell you that almost all the patients had taken appointments except the patients,I had to see for emergency consultation.
Taking care of patients, getting to know their complaints, detailed examination & then suggesting treatment/ investigations which are necessary to them is my passion.
Since I am the only doctor to attend to emergency consultations of my  patients or to attend to urgent call from the wards regarding my patients, we may not be able to stick to the time.
It may be difficult to finish the consultation for some patients faster because of the complicated nature of their problems.
It may not be possible for me to foresee  how many real such tough patients we may get.
I started this appointment  system with the idea to help minimize the waiting period for my patients. 
I'm now wondering whether making it    first come first served will be better for my patients.

tags: Wait time,
review: very bad experience... i booked appointment on 4pm but i meet doctor near 7:30.... no appointment is needed to meet her .. wast of time
reply_text:
You failed to tell that you came not at your time of booking i.e 4 PM but at six PM and wanted to be seen immediately. 
      In fact patients who were in  line before you let you see me, because you were going on telling your official position.
I hope you remember that there were patients in emergency who had to be seen and a patient in  stretcher  also waiting to be seen.
   Patients  like you get the early appointment from 4 PM for their  ( your) own convenience and if four patients come late,  not only will I will be wasting my precious time then, they will make it extremely difficult for us to see the patients with current appointment and those who came late and  tackle patients with emergency problems which needs to be seen soon.
Poor me 😢 sitting with a real passion to help patients
